title: Indonesia, China to Launch Cross-Border QRIS Payment by End-2025
body: Indonesia-China will roll out cross-border QRIS payments by late 2025, easing digital transactions for tourists, students, and businesses.

title: KAI Chief Warns of Financial 'Time Bomb' in Indonesia’s First High-Speed Rail
body: The Whoosh bullet train saw a Rp 1.6 trillion ($100 million) loss in the first half of 2025, of which KAI must shoulder Rp 951.48 billion.

title: Indonesia’s 2026 Growth Target of 5.4% Seen Within Reach, Citi Says
body: Citi says Indonesia’s 5.4% growth target for 2026 is within reach, helped by low-base effect, fiscal stimulus, and resilient farming.

title: Hot Coffee, Cold Trade: US Tariffs Push Bean Prices Up 14%
body: US tariffs are raising prices on coffee, shoes and wine. For Indonesia, the costs are mixed—lost ground in America, gains in Europe.

title: JCI Gain Ahead of BI Meeting as Rupiah Weakens
body: Jakarta stocks rose while the rupiah weakened with Asian peers as investors awaited Bank Indonesia’s rate decision and Fed signals.

title: Indonesia Targets Shadow Economy to Lift $145 Billion in 2026 Tax Revenue
body: Indonesia seeks $145.6b in 2026 tax revenue by targeting shadow economy sectors like retail, gold, and digital trade.

title: Indonesia Shuts 1,800 Fraudulent Lenders and Investment Schemes
body: OJK shut down 1,800 illegal financial entities as scam losses in Indonesia surged to Rp 4.6 trillion ($283 million).

title: Singapore PM Lawrence Wong Expected to Speak at Indonesia’s Investor Daily Summit
body: Lawrence Wong is expected to bring global insight to Indonesia’s top economic forum.

title: Prabowo Government Scales Back Infrastructure Spending on Toll Roads
body: From 2026, the government will allocate funding for only 28 kilometers of new toll roads.

title: Indonesia’s Middle Class Is Shrinking and With It, the Engine of Growth
body: Indonesia’s economy grows 5.1%, but its middle class is shrinking under rising costs and stagnant wages.

title: CPO Gains Offer Support as JCI Tests 8,000 Barrier
body: JCI hovers near 8,000 as profit-taking pressures mount; palm oil rally could offer support for plantation shares.

title: Indonesia Dispatches Workers Abroad with Salaries Up to Rp 50 Million
body: To date, at least 270 Indonesian nurses have been deployed to Germany under the same G-to-G scheme.

title: Indonesia’s Shrinking Middle Class Threatens Growth, Consumption
body: Indonesia’s shrinking middle class is straining consumption, with weaker car sales underscoring risks to Southeast Asia’s largest economy.

title: Rupiah May Strengthen Below Rp 16,000 as Growth Outlook Holds Steady
body: Economists say rupiah could strengthen below 16,000 in 2026 as Indonesia targets 5.4% growth with prudent fiscal management.

title: Think Tank Warns of Tougher Collection as Indonesia Sets Bold 2026 Tax Target
body: The target represents a 13.5 percent jump from this year’s tax intake, aligned with a 7.3 percent increase in state spending.

title: Shadow Economy, Corporate Evaders: Why Indonesia's Tax Ratio Remains Low at 10%
body: Indonesia's tax-to-GDP has remained at around 10 percent over the past few years.

title: Indonesia’s QRIS Payment System Now Accepted in Japan
body: The service is now available at 35 merchants through a partnership with the local payment app JPQR Global.

title: Indonesia and China Launch Trial of Cross-Border QR Payment System
body: Linking Indonesia’s payment network with China will bring significant benefits, including smoother cross-border trade transactions.

title: Indonesia’s Auto Industry Urges Government Support as Malaysia Closes in on Sales Gap
body: Data from the ASEAN Automotive Federation (AAF) shows that Indonesia still led in vehicle sales between January and May 2025.

title: US Eyes Indonesian Semiconductor Ecosystem After Tariff Deal
body: Last year, the US unveiled intentions of backing the human capital development in Indonesian semiconductor industry.

title: Multi Bintang First-Half Profit Climbs on Lager, Premium Beer Sales
body: Multi Bintang’s H1 revenue jumps 6% to Rp1.47t, fueled by lager dominance, premium brand growth, and digital transformation efforts.

title: President Prabowo Orders State Firm Overhaul, Ends Lavish Payouts
body: Prabowo orders sweeping SOE reforms, cutting bloated boards and banning bonuses for loss-making firms to boost state revenue.

title: Indonesia Aims for 5.4 Pct Growth Next Year, No Deficit by 2028
body: Prabowo says that he will continue his budget austerity measures to keep the deficit at 2.48 percent of GDP in 2026.

title: JCI Hits Record High as Prabowo Delivers First State Address
body: Jakarta stocks hit 8,000 intraday for first time as Prabowo pledges growth, attacks corporate greed in debut state address.

title: Prabowo Touts $1 Trillion Danantara Fund as Job-Creation Engine
body: The president also claimed that unemployment has dropped to its lowest level since the 1998 Asian financial crisis.

title: ‘Life is Plastic’: US is Biggest Buyer of Indonesian Toys
body: About 60 percent of Indonesia's toy exports go to the US.

title: Indonesia’s CPO Sector Eyes Strong Finish to 2025 on Price Gains and EU Market Access
body: Global CPO prices have topped $1,000 per ton throughout this year and are expected to climb to $1,100.

title: OJK Dissolves Two Jiwasraya Pension Funds Amid Ongoing Liquidation
body: Jiwasraya -- along with fellow state insurer Asabri -- has been at the center of high-profile corruption and mismanagement scandals.

title: Indonesia Launches Independence Day Shopping Festival to Revive Retail Sales During Low Season
body: The festival offers discounts of up to 80 percent at malls across the nation.

title: From Growth Engine to Vulnerable Group: Indonesia’s Middle Class in Retreat
body: The number of Indonesians classified as middle class dropped from 57.33 million in 2019 to 47.85 million in 2024.

title: Indonesia Still Has No Plans to Import Rice: Gov't
body: Indonesia's rice reserves currently reach 4.3 million tons, according to Deputy Agriculture Minister Sudaryono.

title: Danantara Weighs Land Options for Indonesian Hajj Village Project
body: Sovereign fund Danantara’s boss Rosan Roeslani has traveled to Mecca to get the ball rolling on Indonesia’s Hajj Village plan.

title: From Post Office to Brewery: A Look at the Oldest Firms in Indonesia
body: While most companies last only 40–50 years, these Indonesian firms have thrived for over a century, weathering history’s biggest challenges.

title: KAI Appoints Bobby Rasyidin as CEO in Line With New SOE Law
body: KAI appoints Bobby Rasyidin as president director in a major leadership reshuffle to boost strategy, innovation, and service quality.

title: ADB Approves $500 Million Loan for Indonesia to Improve Tax Collection
body: ADB's policy-based loan comes at a time when Jakarta struggles with its annual tax target and its relatively new Coretax system.

title: Luhut to Meet US Commerce Secretary in September for Tariff Talks
body: Indonesia’s Luhut will meet US Commerce Secretary Lutnick in September to seek tariff relief on key exports hit by Trump’s 19% duties.

title: Energy, Minerals Add $8.6 Billion to Indonesia’s Non-Tax Revenue
body: Mineral resources and coal contribute Rp 74.2 trillion to Indonesia's non-tax revenue in the first half of 2025.

title: Bahlil Inspects $963 Million Floating LNG Facility Being Built for West Papua Gas Field
body: The FLNG unit will process gas from the Asap Kido Merah field in Teluk Bintuni Regency, West Papua, operated by Genting Oil Kasuri Limited.

title: Bank Indonesia Denies Payment ID Will Invade Personal Privacy
body: Bank Indonesia says its Payment ID system will track sector trends, not individuals, and will comply with Indonesia’s data protection law.
